page.title: 18SNAINTON CHURCH
page.content: {Snainton Church of England(Controlled) {Primary School {Built} 1891 The school is at the Eastern side of the village across from the Village Hall and Playing Field.Next to the school is the school house.It is empty All round the school is a wall about 6ft high except at the front where there is a rose garden.The old toilets are across the yard and are now used for stores.There are new indoor toilets built in 1981.There used to be a wall down the playground centre to keep the boys from the girls.In each class there used to be open fires and then coke stoves.Now there is oil fired central heating.There is a spire on the top of the roof with a bell.It used to be rung from inside the class room by pulling a rope.Now we just shout "time".
